descriptionHTML:
🗓️Own your day with this incredible watch face - check all your daily tasks at one glance in a single clean, interactive layout!

Keep track of your most important events and get more info about your goals anytime with a tap of a finger. The Task Master automatically syncs with Google Calendar, seamlessly displaying your daily tasks right on your smartwatch. All events are loaded automatically for selected calendars and shown for the nearest 6 or 9 hours (customizable) to avoid UI cluttering.

☑️Never ever miss any important events again with this unique functional watch face.

🌟Main features:
- Two different versions (Light, Dark);
- Special round and square designs;
- Integrated Google Calendar synchronization;
- Digital and analog time modes;
- Interactive task manager;
- Battery life indicator;
- Smart ambient mode.

✅NEW FEATURES:
- Updated UI elements;
- Updated Ambient Mode;
- Added Update Now button in Settings for Wear 2.0;
- Default event time window set to the nearest 9 hours, with 6 hours window as an option (to avoid UI cluttering).

⌚Is it for me?
The Task Master is designed for Android Wear watches and works perfectly both on circular and rectangular models.

Supports all Android Wear watches, including:
✔ ASUS ZenWatch 1;
✔ ASUS ZenWatch 2;
✔ ASUS ZenWatch 3;
✔ Moto 360 Sport;
✔ Motorola 360 1st gen;
✔ Motorola 360 2nd gen;
✔ LG G Watch;
✔ LG Watch Style;
✔ LG Watch Sport;
✔ LG G Watch Urbane;
✔ LG G Watch Urbane 2;
✔ Samsung Gear Live;
✔ Sony Smartwatch 3;
✔ Casio WSD-F10;
✔ Fossil Q Founder;
✔ Huawei Watch;
✔ Huawei Watch 2;
✔ Polar M600;
✔ TicWatch S, TicWatch E;
✔ TAG Heuer Connected.

💣Important Notice!💥
Samsung Gear, Samsung Gear S, S2 & S3 are NOT YET supported. Please, for Samsung smartwatches based on Tizen follow the link: https://goo.gl/M1ABvk

🚀How to install?
This watch face will be installed automatically from your paired phone.
If it doesn't show up please go to the Android Wear App > Settings and Resync all apps.
Once installed, you can select The Task Master from the Android Wear App or directly on your watch. Proceed with setting up your calendar synchronization.

⚡️How to set up for Wear 2.0:
1) Go to Settings on your smartwatch;
2) Select the “Choose Account” setting;
3) Grant “Allow Calendar to access your contacts” permission;
4) Choose your account or add a new account from your phone;
5) Select the calendars you want to import events from;
6) Wait while loading the events.

⚡️How to set up for Wear 1.X:
1) Go to the Android Wear app on your paired phone;
2) Choose the Task Master watch face;
3) Press the Settings icon;
4) Press the “Sync Accounts” button;
5) Grant “Allow Calendar to access your contacts” permission;
6) Choose your account;
7) Wait while loading available calendars;
8) Select the calendars you want to import events from;
9) Wait while syncing calendar events;
10) In case of an error, please try repeating the steps.

📝Want to drop us a message?
We'd love hearing from you!
Contact us via our website: http://boostwatch.style
Google+ page: https://goo.gl/CJ79u2
or e-mail: wearables@boost.solutions

Are you always in a hurry? The Task Master got you covered!👍
And don't forget to check out our store for more fine-crafted watch faces - https://goo.gl/S4Dcqa🙊
comments: I don't see the brightly colored pie-chart style pictured. I'm only getting low-visibility, muted gray-on-white (or on black) lines and wedges, even for appointments assigned bright colors on my Google calendar. The date obscures the hands near the 9 too much.
Shows up for my Moto360 but not on my Fossil Q at the same time.  Is this by design or through error?

It is really what I want: the price is a bit steep, but it's something really worthy. My suggestion: multiple calendar synchronizations, 12h time span, outlook accounts and more color customization, at least for the hilight color.
Not bad. Works ok on my Huawei Watch 2 Sports. Gives all the relevant information at a glance. Will never miss another appointment.  Thanks.

I would love to give it a try but I have installed and unistalled it multiple times now and cannot get it to show up as an option for my Huawei watch.  I am now past my Google play return time and would like a refund if I cannot get it load on my watch.  I have read through the notes and tried resyncing all apps and it still will not show up.

While it looks useful, I couldn't get this watchface to recognize any events on my Calender and there is no settings to control this at all. My watch is synced so the events show up on other apps on the watch, just not for this. Never take control away from the user like this as it puts them in a situation where they can't do anything to address the problem themselves.  For reference, I'm using a Sony Smartwatch 3 which has a square face.
recentChanges: - Added Update Now button in Settings for Wear 2.0;
- Default event time window set to the nearest 9 hours, with 6 hours window as an option (to avoid UI cluttering);
